question: What are the admission requirements for the Master in Computer Science: Data Science and AI?
answer: Bachelor's degree from a higher education institution, proficiency in English language
contexts:
Title: Admission requirements | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

You are required to indicate how you meet these programme specific admission requirements through our prescreening form.

This prescreening form is an essential element in this assessment, for the Board of Admissions and for yourself. Make sure to complete it rigorously and honestly. Based on your transcripts and the pre-screening form, the Board of Admissions checks if there is a good match of the topics covered by your Bachelor's program and our Bachelor's in Computer Science. The subjects are grouped into "Computer skills", "math skills", "theoretical computer science", "databases", "software engineering", and "computer networks". The board’s flexibility on which of these groups are not covered by courses you have taken is very limited. Also, self-study is only taken into account as reinforcement in a group where insufficiently many courses are listed, not as a replacement.

3.      Language requirements

3.      Language requirements

The programme is taught in English and an academic level of proficiency in this language is imperative.

Candidates with a bachelor degree from universities outside Flanders are required to demonstrate their English language skills in by submitting one of the language certificates listed [here](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master-and-advanced-master/admission-requirements/).

Title: Admission and enrolment | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

First, check if you meet the admission requirements to ensure that you are eligible to start the programme.

If you meet these requirements, you can proceed with the application.

Title: Programme info | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: programme-info

- 120 ECTS-credits
- Programme taught in English
- [Faculty of Science](/en/faculties/facultyofscience/), [Department of Mathematics and Computer Science](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/about-uantwerp/faculties/faculty-of-science/research/departments-and-research-groups/)
- [Campus Middelheim](/en/campus-life/on-your-way-to-campus/campus-middelheim/)

# What does the programme entail?

You can choose between three majors:

- [Computer Networks](/en/education/education-and-training/master-computernetworks/profile/)
- [Data Science](/en/education/education-and-training/master-data-science/profile/)
- [Software Engineering](/en/education/education-and-training/master-software-engineering/profile/)

The programme focuses on Research and Development. In contrast to the Dutch programme equivalent, there are no majors/minors such as Education or Management.

The two years are built out of 4 blocks:

- Master thesis "30 credits" (compulsory)
- Elective courses "30 credits"
- General competences "30 credits" (compulsory)
- Two research internships "15 credits each" (compulsory)

[Download the programme structure](https://medialibrary.uantwerpen.be/oldcontent/container1991/files/MCS%20ProgrStruct2016-2017%20OC20150513.pdf)

# Are you eligible to start the programme?

More information on admission and enrollment can be found on [this page.](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/programmes/all-programmes/master-data-science/admission-and-enrolment/)

Title: Application | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

# Bachelor's degree from the Benelux and you do not have to apply for a visa?

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that grants direct admission AND you are not required to have a visa, you don’t need to proceed via Mobility Online.

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that does not grant direct admission AND you are not required to have a visa, you will have to apply for [permission](https://studhelp.uantwerpen.be/wetenschappen/knowledgebase.php?article=121) from the faculty. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

# Bachelor's degree from the Benelux but you have to apply for a visa?

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that grants direct admission BUT you are required to have a visa, you have to submit an [online application](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/) via Mobility Online. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

# Bachelor's degree outside Benelux?

If you obtained a bachelor's or master's degree from a higher education institution OUTSIDE Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg, you need to submit an [online application](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/) via Mobility Online, before you can enrol. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

Title: Tuition fees, scholarships and costs | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

Only applicants who are [academically admitted](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/), can apply for the tuition fee reduction.

The application deadline is 31 August. The applicant will be informed of the decision within 3 weeks after the application deadline. There will be no further communication on the decision.

Title: Study programme | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: study-programme

## Master thesis Computer Science: Data Science and artificial intelligence

- **Course code:** 2503WETMAP
- **Semester:** 2E SEM
- **ECTS-credits:** 30 ECTS-credits
- **Study load (hours):** 840
- **Contract restrictions:** Exam contract not possible
- **Language of instruction:** English
- **Exam Period:** exam in the 2nd semester
- **Credit required to obtain degree:** Yes
- **Study domain:** Computer Science
- **Lecturer(s):** Wout Bittremieux, Toon Calders, Moharram Challenger, Serge Demeyer, Jeroen Famaey, Floris Geerts, Bart Goethals, Kris Laukens, José Antonio Oramas Mogrovejo, Guillermo Alberto Perez, Hans Vangheluwe, Benny Van Houdt

Title: Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: profile

# Your programme

During your study at the University of Antwerp, you can live through a wide variety of applications of computer science. You will get first hand experience in a challenging, creative, dynamic and multi-disciplinary environment where you can contribute to the realisation of international projects.

A degree in Computer Science at the University of Antwerp co...
ground_truth: Applicants need a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field comparable to UAntwerp's bachelor.

question: How many ECTS credits is the Master in Data Science programme?
answer: According to the programme info [1], the Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence programme has 120 ECTS-credits. However, this information refers to the overall programme, not specifically the Master thesis "Computer Science: Data Science and artificial intelligence" which is 30 ECTS-credits [2]. The programme structure consists of 4 blocks with varying credit values, including elective courses and research internships [3]. It's worth noting that a separate study programme, Master in Data Science, is also mentioned on the University of Antwerp's website, but its specific credit value is not provided.

question: What are the tuition fees for international students?
answer: The fee reduction is only applicable to students who would otherwise need to pay the increased rate of [tuition fees](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/enrolment/tuition-fees/tuition-fees-2024-2025/).
contexts:
Title: Tuition fees, scholarships and costs | Master of Computer Science: Computer Networks | University of Antwerp | Program: CN | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

Tuition fee reduction

The Faculty of Science at the University of Antwerp grants a limited number of tuition fee reductions to international students with demonstrated academic excellence who register for the first time one of our master programmes listed below. The fee reduction is only applicable to students who would otherwise need to pay the increased rate of [tuition fees](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/enrolment/tuition-fees/tuition-fees-2024-2025/).

To be eligible for a fee reduction the applicant needs to fulfil at least the following criteria:

- does not yet have      a master degree
- has      no other scholarship
- has      a clear and profound motivation
- and has a high standard      of academic performance

Only applicants who are [academically admitted](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/), can apply for the tuition fee reduction.

Title: Tuition fees, scholarships and costs | Master of Computer Science: Software Engineering | University of Antwerp | Program: SE | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

Title: Application | Master of Computer Science: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence | University of Antwerp | Program: DS | Page Type: admission-and-enrolment

# Bachelor's degree from the Benelux and you do not have to apply for a visa?

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that grants direct admission AND you are not required to have a visa, you don’t need to proceed via Mobility Online.

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that does not grant direct admission AND you are not required to have a visa, you will have to apply for [permission](https://studhelp.uantwerpen.be/wetenschappen/knowledgebase.php?article=121) from the faculty. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

# Bachelor's degree from the Benelux but you have to apply for a visa?

If you have a bachelor's degree from a higher education institution IN Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg that grants direct admission BUT you are required to have a visa, you have to submit an [online application](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/) via Mobility Online. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

# Bachelor's degree outside Benelux?

If you obtained a bachelor's or master's degree from a higher education institution OUTSIDE Belgium, the Netherlands or Luxembourg, you need to submit an [online application](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/study/admission-and-enrolment/admission/master/) via Mobility Online, before you can enrol. Pay attention to the deadlines!

You can submit your application, even if you do not yet meet all the requirements, providing you expect to do so before the applicable deadlines.

question: What programming languages are taught in the Software Engineering track?
answer:
Unfortunately, there is no explicit mention of programming languages taught in the Software Engineering track within the provided context. However, based on general knowledge and the fact that it's a Master's program in Computer Science with a focus on Software Engineering, one can assume that students will learn various programming languages [1]. Specifically, programming paradigms are mentioned as a course topic (2001WETPPA), which typically involves learning multiple programming languages, such as object-oriented, functional, and imperative programming [2].

Therefore, while we cannot pinpoint specific languages without further information, it's likely that students will learn one or more programming languages in the Software Engineering track.

References:
[1] "Computer Science" Wikipedia article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_science)
[2] Programming paradigms course description (context provided)
